db:abstract.db:para: The QCamera class defines a view point through which the scene will be rendered.
This class was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: enum QCamera::CameraTranslationOption
db:section.db:para: This enum specifies how camera view center is translated

db:td.db:para: Translate the view center causing the view direction to remain the same
Don't translate the view center causing the view direction to change

db:section.db:title: aspectRatio : float
db:section.db:para: Holds the current aspect ratio.

db:section.db:title: bottom : float
db:section.db:para: Holds the current bottom of the camera.
This property is only relevant when projectionType is QCameraLens::OrthographicProjection.

db:section.db:title: exposure : float
db:section.db:para: Holds the current exposure of the camera.
The default value is 0.0.

The MetalRoughMaterial in Qt 3D Extras is currently the only provided material that makes use of camera exposure. Negative values will cause the material to be darker, and positive values will cause it to be lighter.
Custom materials may choose to interpret the value differently.

db:section.db:title: farPlane : float
db:section.db:para: Holds the current camera far plane. Objects that are farther from the camera than the farPlane will not be rendered.

db:section.db:title: fieldOfView : float
db:section.db:para: Holds the current vertical field of view in degrees.

Along with aspectRatio, this property determines how much of the scene is visible to the camera. In that respect you might think of it as analogous to choosing a wide angle (wide horizontal field of view) or telephoto (narrow horizontal field of view) lens depending on how much of a scene you want to capture.
fieldOfView is only relevant when projectionType is QCameraLens::PerspectiveProjection.

db:section.db:title: left : float
db:section.db:para: Holds the current left of the camera.
This property is only relevant when projectionType is QCameraLens::OrthographicProjection.

db:section.db:title: [read-only, since 5.14] lens : Qt3DRender::QCameraLens* const
db:section.db:para: Holds the Qt3DRender::QCameraLens component of the camera.
This property was introduced in Qt 5.14.

db:section.db:title: nearPlane : float
db:section.db:para: Holds the current camera near plane. Objects that are closer to the camera than the nearPlane will not be rendered.

db:section.db:title: position : QVector3D
db:section.db:para: Holds the camera's position in coordinates relative to the parent entity.

db:section.db:title: projectionMatrix : QMatrix4x4
db:section.db:para: Holds the current projection matrix of the camera.

db:section.db:title: projectionType : Qt3DRender::QCameraLens::ProjectionType
db:section.db:para: Holds the type of the camera projection. The default value is QCameraLens::PerspectiveProjection.

db:listitem.db:para: QCameraLens::OrthographicProjection - Parallel lines appear parallel. Objects appear the same size regardless of distance.
QCameraLens::PerspectiveProjection - Parallel lines appear to meet in the distance. Objects appear to shrink the farther they are from the camera.

db:section.db:title: right : float
db:section.db:para: Holds the current right of the camera.
This property is only relevant when projectionType is QCameraLens::OrthographicProjection.

db:section.db:title: top : float
db:section.db:para: Holds the current top of the camera.
This property is only relevant when projectionType is QCameraLens::OrthographicProjection.

db:section.db:title: [read-only, since 5.14] transform : Qt3DCore::QTransform* const
db:section.db:para: Holds the Qt3DCore::QTransform component of the camera.
This property was introduced in Qt 5.14.

db:section.db:title: upVector : QVector3D
db:section.db:para: Holds the camera's up vector in coordinates relative to the parent entity.

The up vector indicates which direction the top of the camera is facing. Think of taking a picture: after positioning yourself and pointing the camera at your target, you might rotate the camera left or right, giving you a portrait or landscape (or angled!) shot. upVector allows you to control this type of movement.

db:section.db:title: viewCenter : QVector3D
db:section.db:para: Holds the camera's view center in coordinates relative to the parent entity.
Intuitively, the viewCenter is the location the camera is pointing at.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] viewVector : const QVector3D
db:section.db:para: Holds the camera's view vector in coordinates relative to the parent entity.
This vector decribes the displacement from the camera (position) to its target (viewCenter).

db:section.db:title: void QCamera::viewAll()
db:section.db:para: Rotates and moves the camera so that it's viewCenter is the center of the scene's bounding volume and the entire scene fits in the view port.

db:note.db:para: Only works if the lens is in perspective or orthographic projection mode.

db:section.db:title: void QCamera::viewEntity(Qt3DCore::QEntity *entity)
db:section.db:para: Rotates and moves the camera so that it's viewCenter is the center of the entity's bounding volume and the entire entity fits in the view port.

db:note.db:para: Only works if the lens is in perspective or orthographic projection mode.

db:section.db:title: void QCamera::viewSphere(const QVector3D &center, float radius)
db:section.db:para: Rotates and moves the camera so that it's viewCenter is center and a sphere of radius fits in the view port.

db:note.db:para: Only works if the lens is in perspective or orthographic projection mode.
